data.title: Very Enjoyable Stay
data.text: Excellent service could be found from the staff ,the valet to the restaurant . Everyone was so friendly and helpful. Chris was exceptionally nice to make our stay more pleasurable. The rooms were very comfortable, beautiful and well appointed. The building renovation is asset to downtown and to the history of the area. We will definitely come back next trip.

data.title: Nice but a little off
data.text: This hotel is pretty and very trendy and has a lovely restaurant, but it's a bit off. We ordered room service and they forgot our silverware and it took a while, even after we called twice. But the hotel is absolutely beautiful and the staff is very friendly. Dogs are allowed ! Would go back, but it's not the easiest experience.

data.title: Beautiful Property that is understaffed
data.text:
The Kimpton Cardinal is a beautiful property, with some very well thought out design aspects -- Waterworks fixtures, soaking tub within a huge walk in shower and Atelier Bloem shampoo, conditioner and body wash products.  Sadly, it is woefully understaffed and the staff they have, is not well trained.  The valet parking experience is a nightmare at prime time, with a long line of cars left double parked all along North Main Street.  Getting your car back is similarly challenged.  Likewise, the lines at the front desk are long, both for check in (where David, the hotel manager on duty, checked us in -- he copped major attitude and left us feeling not at all welcomed) and the multiple times we had to go back to get new key cards because the ones we had, stopped working.  Housekeeping did a cursory job in keeping up the room (no extra toilet paper, carpet not vacuumed and a used wash cloth not taken).  

Katherine, the in house restaurant, was fantastic in comparison, with great food and a very well trained staff.  

Our nephew is a student at Wake Forest, so we will return to Winston Salem.  I can only hope the Kimpton Cardinal gets its act together before the next time we are in town.

owner_response.author: KCHFO, Front Office Manager at The Kimpton Cardinal Hotel, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for your review Mark G,

I hate to hear that you didn't fully enjoy your stay. I will be sure to pass along all of your concerns to the correct departments to ensure this doesn't happen again.

If you would like to discuss this further please contact me, Amanda, at the hotel to get more details about your stay (336) 724-1009

I can assure you that the next time you come to stay with us your stay will be a wonderful one!

Thank you,
Amanda D.
Front Office Supervisor

The Kimpton Cardinal Hotel
51 E. Fourth Street, Winston-Salem, NC 27101
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: An Art Deco restoration in the heart of Winston
data.text:
Here's the bias up front: we have loved the Reynolds building for years -- its' link to the Empire State Building, its contribution to the Winston-Salem skyline and its stunning Art Deco interior. So, when we found out Kimpton was putting in a hotel on the first six or seven floors, we had high hopes.

And the company did not disappoint.

The Cardinal is a stylish, stunning addition to the Winston-Salem hotel scene, with a beautiful restaurant/bar/raw bar, lovely lobby, incredible game level, well-appointed rooms (who would think that magnolia blossoms actually look good with deer antlers?) and, of course, Kimpton hospitality -- coffee in the morning, wine in the afternoons and all-day dog treats for your canine friends.

We have a canine friend -- an old, big dog -- so we also love that Kimpton welcomes pets regardless of size (some people may not like this, so if encountering a large dog in the lobby is not your thing, be aware it could happen). Although they accept animals, the room we stayed in was fresh and fabulous, no trace of animal smells.

If anything, even though the entire hotel is non-smoking, I did smell a faint trace of tobacco in the room. It could have been a noncompliant guest, or maybe, just a whiff of the ghosts of tobacco past; this is the R.J. Reynolds building, after all.

Did not use the fantastic amenities on the basement floor but did have appetizers and brunch in the restaurant, and both are recommended. 

Kimpton did a fantastic job on the renovations, modernizing without destroying the beauty of this architectural masterpiece.

Bravo. Can't wait to return.

p.s. I have to say I stupidly left a piece of electronics in my room and when I noticed it was missing weeks later, I called and they had it. Many thanks again to Brandon (sp?)

owner_response.author: KCHFO, Front Office Manager at The Kimpton Cardinal Hotel, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you so much for your review Peripatetic4!

We are a little bias too :) I am so glad that you a wonderful stay with us! You have to come back so you can go down our slide and bowl a few frames!

Hope to see you again soon,

Amanda D.
Front Office Supervisor

The Kimpton Cardinal Hotel

data.title: An artifice of a business hotel-don't waste money here
data.text:
I strongly warn you- BEWARE OF THIS PLACE- this was not a typical Kimpton experience.  

This was suppose to be a splurge, ending a stressful 3 week business trip in comfort. Disappointing, irritating--I'll never come back here unless there's new management.

1.  Advised them I was arriving after midnight when I booked online. When I arrive exhausted, they say they downgraded me because I had requested a room away from elevator. When I say I want the bigger room that I booked, they admit they no longer have the room available. When I ask for what the new room rate is, they do not give the information except to say the bill will be adjusted
2. Took 4 trips to desk to get working door cards. The last time, clerk fails to see I had paid for late check-out so that card became non-functional after 12 noon on check out day.
3.  On the day of check-out at 11am, a staff person knocks on the door and wants to know when I will be leaving.  I tell her that I paid for late check out (per the website this is good until 3pm). She still insists on knowing when we would be leaving.
   At check-out clerk implies I was upgraded. I correct her that I was downgraded and I wanted to know what the room rate charge was. She says $30 was removed from the bill and because I did not use the honor bar, removed an additional $10.
   I was charged for the queen queen premier AAA rate,  $230/night.  On review of their website for the last night I stayed, it was $195 for the same room
4. The room while beautiful and large cannot accommodate 2 people on business. It had 1 sink, 1 towel rack, 1 towel hook, 1 chair (for desk), a closet that had 4 ft wide usable space, 2 drawers the size of a small file cabinet in the closet. The walk in shower had 2 shower heads and could easily fit 6 people inside- go figure. Website said the room would have 2 HDTV and a comfortable chair but the chair was missing and there was only 1 TV.
5. Honor bar was missing several items on arrival
6. Door to room is very heavy but still inadequate in blocking corridor noise out. In fact, you can hear doors slamming because they're difficult to control due to the weight.
7. Lighting in the room is inadequate to do work. There is a large 4 ft desk but you're given a single bulb desk lamp. There is a torchier and a 2 bulb soft light between the beds.  The bathroom has bright lights so you can see what you look like before you leave the room.
8. Using the room thermostat is not easy.  There are no written instructions. Had to have someone from engineering explain the system. Advice for warmth- set the temp and make certain fan is off and thermostat is on "warm mode"
9. The beautiful lounge is not set up to do business work, when you can't stand being in your room. Chair/sofa height to tables are ergonomically poor.  Not to mention the location of the electrical plugs are limiting where you might work.

Thank you,

data.title: Fabulous Hotel, Must Stay Here
data.text:
Great decor overall, has a modern feel to an old design. Stayed in the King Deluxe Room. Room was great, staff were great. Breakfast at The Katharine was very good - the eggs were great, the croissant was amazing, pastries so fresh and tasty. The best hotel breakfast I've had so far. Room amenities were really nice - the Atelier Bloem products smell great, and the bathrobes were so comfortable, I wish I'd had space in my luggage to purchase one and take home!

Good gym, lots of equipment but a little cozily packed together, so need to be mindful when you're working out to a) not hit another equipment; b) not hit another gym goer; c) not block anyone's way. Otherwise, it's a great gym. They also have a two-lane bowling alley, a small basketball court, foosball, pool, table tennis, and a big slide.

Free wifi is available for Kimpton Karma Rewards members, but it's so easy (and free) to sign up. I'd signed up for it in another Kimpton hotel in Philadelphia last year (another great hotel too) and was able to use the wifi for free here.

Location is within walking distance to Trade Street and surrounding areas for some local shopping and restaurants.

Fabulous hotel, highly recommended.

owner_response.text:

Hope to see you back soon!

data.title: Shhh! Let's keep the basement a secret.
data.text:
Our family stayed at the Cardinal while in town for a college visit. You'd better bring your A game if you want to impress a pair of exhausted teens. This hotel delivered. 
The secret, if you can find it, is in the basement. Cool doesn't begin to describe the space they've created. We found two lanes of bowling, half a basketball court, comfortable seating, high-top tables and bar stools , ping pong, shuffleboard and a jukebox. I hope I remembered everything. 
We had planned to take the family out for a night on the town, but how do you compete with this? We ended up at a sports bar, but probably should have ordered a pizza and stayed put. 
The room was a typical Kimpton room, modern inside an historic property, sliding barn door for the bathroom. Beds were just ok. Suggestion - more outlets to charge all of our devices. There was an iron and an ironing board, but I couldn't find a outlet within reach of a space large enough for the ironing board. 
If we receive an acceptance letter, we'll be booking a room for parents' weekend and any other opportunity to visit.

owner_response.author: KCHFO, Front Office Manager at The Kimpton Cardinal Hotel, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for your review Susan O!

I am so glad you and your family had a great time with us! 
Thank you for your suggestion on the outlets I will make sure to pass it along!

We will keep our fingers crossed on that acceptance letter, and hope to see you back here soon!

Thank you,
Amanda D.
Front Office Supervisor
 
The Kimpton Cardinal Hotel

data.title: Wedding Night - Historic
data.text:
-Please read-
Ah-Maze-Ing! (Amazing!) My wife and I married in July. I wanted a nice place to stay and to feel like royalty before our Honey Moon. David Fridvalszki made this happen for me. He keep in contact with me several times prior to our check-in and even sent out wishes before the wedding. I wanted to make it rememberable for my wife, the guest, and the city. I thought what if I could change the lights on top of the building. I also thought it would be impossible but I asked anyway. David didn't hesitate, he said he would do everything in his power to make this happen. As the toast were being giving at the reception down the block. David had the lights on the building shine with our wedding colors! I can truly say that this hotel was the exclamation point to the evening! Beautiful rooms, indoor basketball court, pool table, and bowling right downstairs and with David's help, I felt like a King and the city was ours! Thanks so much!

data.title: Best Hotel Experience In A While
data.text: Came to this location not knowing what to expect. I was blown away with it's design, staff, amenities and room. Very nice attention to detail. I had a suite which was unlike any I've stayed in before. Beds were comfortable, bathroom was extremely large with a tub deeper than any I've seen. It's located in a great area, easy walk to the parking garage and night life. I plan to come back again as soon as I need to stay in town again.

data.title: Outstanding converted office block
data.text: This hotel is a great example of converting what was a head office for one of the big tobacco company's in Winston-Salem into a beautiful hotel with apartments on the upper floors. The bar has an indoor and outdoor section and the restaurant had excellent service and food. The staff on the front desk were very helpful with an issue I had with a lost bag from American. If you're visiting the area I recommend.

data.title: Very nice hotel but not room 309
data.text:
The Cardinal Kimpton is a beautiful hotel and great location to nearby  restaurants. My check-in was quick but couldn't get a late check-out. The room was very spacious with modern decor. Room 309 was located across from the elevator and facing Main Street. My biggest compliant was being able to hear the pinging of the elevators all morning.

I want to thank the hotel for the treats left in the room.

data.title: Adults Paradise in downtown Winston Salem
data.text: Loved getting to stay here for a Business meeting. The downstairs which includes a playground for adults-Basketball Court, bowling alley, slide, shuffle board, and pool table! It was a pet Friendly hotel as well and people who had their pet did not bother me as business traveler as this place is immaculate and well kept. I will be back for a leisure visit in the future! Loved the location. Wish had better options with downtown parking as $8.00 a night in the parking deck is high and $20.00 for Valet is also high I went ahead and did Valet which was much easier! Food was great for the conference! The bed was so comfortable along with the bedding and pillows and I enjoyed that very much! Loved the bathroom as well!

data.title: Quirky marvelous hotel
data.text: We did a spontaneous trip and ended up at this charming downtown hotel. It was easy to make a reservation with an actual person and I was thrilled they accepted pets with no outrageous deposits (none!) or size restrictions. It's very pet friendly. They have an entire recreation room on the bottom level. The food was wonderful; we had delicious decedent burgers and a fresh flavorful shrimp salad. The free wine happy hour was, of course, a lovely bonus. All the staff was professional, friendly and courteous. The manager, David, was attentive and gracious, even in the face of an outrageous guest making an irrational fuss. He stayed calm and classy. A fantastic stay!

data.title: I can't believe this is Winston-Salem!!!
data.text: We have been coming to Winston-Salem for 5 years while visiting our daughter at Wake Forest.  We have tried many of the accommodations in the area.  They were all fine.  But the Cardinal is just awesome!  It really has the feel of a cool NYC hotel.  The new hotel was built in an older art deco building that was the inspiration for the Empire State Building.  The restoration was perfectly done.  The art deco features are gorgeous.  The people are extremely nice and helpful.  The bar/restaurant is exceptional.  The bar is gorgeous and has a great vibe at night.  Breakfast in the restaurant is very good (superior to anything that we have had in a hotel in the area!).  The rooms are HUGE, beautiful and clean.  The bed was excellent and the shower immense.  The location downtown is perfect.  Easy walking distance to restaurants, shops, the arts area and the recently renovated innovation quarter.  We will never stay anywhere else when we come to Winston-Salem!!!

data.title: Friendly Staff
data.text: Wanted to stay at a nice hotel in Winston-Salem and this was a nice choice. The staff was so friendly and polished. From the time we checked in at the front desk to the afternoon drink at the bar, we were treated as special guests. It appears that staff training is very important to this company. I loved the old world atmosphere of the hotel lobby and common areas as well as the modern rooms which were crisp and clean. We were pleased with the dinner at The Katherine as well. Service was well paced. Would definitely recommend the Kimpton Cardinal and I look forward to staying there if I'm ever in Winston-Salem again.

data.title: It's the little extras...
data.text: From the moment we checked in (early) service and my stay  was top notch. The hotel is dog friendly and even had treats at the front desk for them.  There was a Yoga mat and umbrella  in closet as well as a flashlight in the  nightstand, nice touches!  I enjoyed the wine hour in the lobby, wine and little appetizers were served.  My room was spacious and the bed was comfortable. The valet attendants were courteous and efficient. I was on a low floor and could hear a train in the morning.  The hotel is the former RJ Reynolds building and is a miniature version and the inspiration for New York's Empire State building. The hotel is within walking distance of shops and restaurants. I would recommend this hotel and I would stay there again when in Winston-Salem.

data.title: Wonderful visit! This hotel is truly a gem!
data.text: I stayed here for two nights on business in September and was very pleased with my visit. The staff was excellent from the valets outside to the front desk, housekeeping, and room service. My room was on the small side but very comfortable and immaculately clean. I love Kimpton's little touches like full-size spa bath products and they have everything you could possibly need at the front desk in case you forget something which I had to utilize this visit. I'm 7 months pregnant so didn't take advantage of the wine happy hour or amenities such as the bowling alley and game room but saw plenty of happy people enjoying them. Room service was expensive but quick and the food was good. I also dined at The Katharine for dinner one night and breakfast one morning and had great service and food. Would highly recommend this hotel and will stay here again next time I am in town on business. One tip: join the Kimpton Karma Rewards program for free wifi and a $10 Raid the Mini Bar coupon to use at every Kimpton Hotel. It's free!
